pullrequest.title: Expanding the functionality of the plugin framework, and introducing PluginPtr and specializations

content.raw: Every IDE autocomplete that I can remember working with (Qt, CLion, and Visual Studio) will show a list of all overloads for a function, both the public and the private versions. There is usually some icon next to the function name to indicate whether it's public or private, but that icon is easy to overlook, and just the existence of multiple overloads for the function could throw users off.
content.html: Every IDE autocomplete that I can remember working with (Qt, CLion, and Visual Studio) will show a list of all overloads for a function, both the public and the private versions. There is usually some icon next to the function name to indicate whether it's public or private, but that icon is easy to overlook, and just the existence of multiple overloads for the function could throw users off.
